content:
Off and on showers in the forecast all week. One of them just went over Citi Field and delayed the Met game on PIX 11. So we might be on late tonight. 
Here's our latest F/B live to keep you covered until then................
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: PIX 11

content:
It's Hurricane Preparedness Week! To mark the occasion, the Hurricane Awareness Tour will be along the east coast this week and stop #2 is right here in our backyard at ISP- MacArthur Airport tomorrow- Monday 5/8. I'll be there tomorrow though I can't be sure what time. It should be a fascinating tour, lecture and chance to speak with the hurricane pros. The details are in the links below:

https://www.weather.gov/wrn/hurricane-preparedness

http://www.weather.gov/okx/2017HAT
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Hurricane Preparedness Week 2017

content:
Spent midday at L.I. MacArthur Airport. Day #2 of the Hurricane Awareness Tour. Informative and fascinating looking at the equipment and listening to the stories from pilots and crew members of the storms they've been through.
This is an interview of the NHC's director Dr Rick Knabb and our NWS/OKX MIC I. Ross Dickman. Winds were gusting 30-35 mph and someone should have thought about a windscreen for the microphone, lol

My main camera/phone bit the dust today so I went to my backup and am trying to post my interview with the pilot, later.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: NOAA NWS National Hurricane Center

name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Photos from Craig Allen On-Air Inc's post

content:
A great voice and superb news anchor has been silenced by cancer. You probably heard his voice most recently on 1010 WINS. A program director at WALK-FM and you might remember he did traffic on 880.
Such a genuine, friendly person filled with stories and kindness. RIP Gene and condolences to the family.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: 1010 WINS

content:
An out-of-season nor'easter will drench the #wcbs880 WCBS Newsradio 880 area Saturday into Saturday night. Much of the area will receive an average of 1 to 2" of rain. Like a winter snowstorm, we'll have to watch and determine where the heaviest bands of rain set up. Some places may pick up 1/2 to 1" of rain while others are soaked with 2 to 3".  Winds may gust above 30 mph, especially along the coast.

The maps show the distribution of the rain and also show the center of the storm moving away from the coast on Sunday. This should lead to slowly improving weather though leftover showers are still expected on Mothers Day. However, the final map is the 6-10 day outlook and that shows temperatures are likely to be above normal as soon as this last storm leaves and this stubborn pattern breaks down. It will finally feel like May and possibly even more like June
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Photos from Craig Allen On-Air Inc's post

content:
We've got the New York Mets game on PIX 1111. I'd love to go on with our 10pm newscast on time but it's a close game with Mets up 3-2 in the top of the 5th.
So here's some weather info for you now to help plan for Mother's Day and the week ahead. You'll be amazed how much it will change in a matter of days!
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: PIX 11

content:
The Saturday soaker has turned into a magnificent day for Mom....so far. There is still a very good chance of showers and thunderstorms in parts of the area later this afternoon and evening though. 
Wishing all the Mom's a wonderful day !!
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Photos from Craig Allen On-Air Inc's post

content: See how fast it changed? Showers and thunderstorms roaming many parts of the PIX 11 tri-state region. Bar-b-queing for Mom? Take cover. Downpours with several reports of wind damage coming in. Camera shows it approaching. Svr Tstm Wrng (Orange) in effect until 5:45.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Photos from Craig Allen On-Air Inc's post

content:
It is beautiful out there.
A W/NW wind should even keep the sea breeze at bay until late day, if then, so even LI and the CT coast will warm up.
Wed & Thu might not fit your top 10 criteria since it will get quite warm and more humid.

So ENJOY today!! We earned it.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Timeline Photos

content: May? Not even normal for August in some cases. Many record highs smashed, after record overnight warmth. One more hot one then a return to an early spring feel for the weekend.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: US National Weather Service New York NY

content:
First May heat wave in 16 years. Plus more high temp and 'high, low-temp, records broken today. But that's it...we won't be talking about heat waves again for another week or two at least.
Stay cool this evening. Isolated thunderstorms for next couple hours then open the windows and turn off the a/c late tonight.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Timeline Photos

content:
For those of you keeping score, out of the dozens and dozens of sources of info to use to make a 24 hour forecast, only 1 model picked up on today's clouds and showers.😒 The #HRRR model  has been showing today's scattered showers since midday yesterday.😮 Yet, apparently none of us wanted to buy into that outlier solution.🤔🤐 Well, once again-as it has so many times this spring- the HRRR wins and we lose.😠 It's not a major system; the much cooler weather rushed in as expected, but now you'll need to dodge a few raindrops as well. The proof is posted showing noon thru 2pm then the current radar.

Tomorrow is a little better but Monday still looks like a wet day.
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Photos from Craig Allen On-Air Inc's post

content: Sunday will be better. Monday will be wetter. The rest of the week?.....
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: PIX 11

content: Here we go again. Another soggy system on the way to start your Monday. Ugh. Any hope for next weekend?
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: PIX 11

content: About 2/3" of rain so far today bringing my total rainfall for the year to 22.22" as of 2:22 pm on 5/22. Anyone think I should play the number 2 in lotto tonight?  🤑   🌧️=💲
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Timeline Photos

content:
#NHC issued their tropical outlook for the summer of 2017. Not a very precise #hurricane forecast for our #wcbs880 WCBS Newsradio 880 area or anywhere in the Atlantic basin area... but it's not meant to be. It's a general guideline of what kind of season it might be, not who will get hit or who won't have to worry. 
Alot of uncertainty comes from the fact that this was supposed to be an El Nino summer to keep the season a little quieter but those ENSO conditions have barely developed. Thus, the forecast number of storms has to be ramped up.

The MOST IMPORTANT part of the article is the paragraph following the storm names. It only takes one in your backyard.....

http://www.noaa.gov/media-release/above-normal-atlantic-hurricane-season-is-most-likely-year
name: Craig Allen On-Air Inc
title: Above-normal Atlantic hurricane season is most likely this year | National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration

Awesome but also frightening pictures and video of strong to severe thunderstorms all over twitter this evening. I retweeted several (faster than re loading it on here) Go to:  https://twitter.com/CraigAllenWx

There's no doubt that the Dutchess Cty storm had rotation. Radar showed it as well. It will likely be classified as a tornado after NWS  investigation.

And below, 2 shots from Tom Kaminski 's son in NJ earlier this evening.
